snippet.desc: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right.
snippet.description: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right.
snippet.name: 4 Way Movement

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to turn while moving.
boolean.name: _StopTurning

number.desc: The speed of the movement.
number.name: _Speed

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will stop moving if diagonal keys are pressed at the same.
If unselected, the actor will move in the direction of the most recently pressed key.
boolean.name: _DiagonalStop

boolean.desc:
If selected, the control attributes will be used to control the movement.
If unselected, the control attributes are ignored and the movement can be controlled by triggering custom events.
Trigger the events MoveUp, MoveDown, MoveLeft or MoveRight to make the actor move as if the keys were pressed.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, the animation attributes will be used, otherwise they will be ignored.
boolean.name: _UseAnimations

snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make the camera follow it. You can then specify the speed at which the camera should "scroll" towards the actor.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make the camera follow it. You can then specify the speed at which the camera should "scroll" towards the actor.
snippet.name: Camera Follow

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The x-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The y-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraY

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current x-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current y-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraY

number.desc: The speed, in pixels per frame, that the camera should scroll by following the actor. Leave as 0 to indicate an instant jump.
number.name: _ScrollSpeed

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The x-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The y-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraY

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current x-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current y-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraY

number.desc: The speed, in pixels per frame, that the camera should scroll by following the actor. Leave as 0 to indicate an instant jump.
number.name: _ScrollSpeed

snippet.desc: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right as well as in diagonal directions.
snippet.description: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right as well as in diagonal directions.
snippet.name: 8 Way Movement

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will move in diagonal directions at the same speed as in axis-aligned directions.
If unselected, the actor will move in diagonal direction at a speed that is the sum of the axis-aligned velocities.
boolean.name: _NormalizeDiagonalSpeed

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to turn while moving.
boolean.name: _StopTurningWhileMoving

boolean.desc:
If selected, the control attributes will be used to control the movement.
If unselected, the control attributes are ignored and the movement can be controlled by triggering custom events.
Trigger the events MoveUp, MoveDown, MoveLeft or MoveRight to make the actor move as if the keys were pressed.
boolean.name: _UseControls

number.desc: The speed of the movement.
number.name: _Speed

boolean.desc: If selected, the animation attributes will be used, otherwise they will be ignored.
boolean.name: _UseAnimations

boolean.desc: If selected and moving in a diagonal direction, the Up and Down animations will be used, otherwise the Left and Right animations will be used.
boolean.name: _PreferVerticalAnimtations

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The x-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The y-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraY

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current x-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current y-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraY

number.desc: The speed, in pixels per frame, that the camera should scroll by following the actor. Leave as 0 to indicate an instant jump.
number.name: _ScrollSpeed

snippet.desc: Switch scene when an actor enters a region.
snippet.description: Switch scene when an actor enters a region.
snippet.name: Switch Scene on Enter Region

region.desc: The region which will trigger the scene switch.
region.name: _Region

actor.desc: The actor that will trigger the scene switch when entering the region.
actor.name: _Actor

boolean.desc: If selected, only switch scene, when <var>Switch Control</var> is pressed, while the actor is within the region.
boolean.name: _OnlySwitchOnKeyPress

control.desc: The Control to trigger the scene switch if <var>Only Switch On Key Press</var> is selected.
control.name: _SwitchControl

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the switch scene transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The x-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The y-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraY

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current x-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current y-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraY

number.desc: The speed, in pixels per frame, that the camera should scroll by following the actor. Leave as 0 to indicate an instant jump.
number.name: _ScrollSpeed

snippet.desc: Makes the actor follow the mouse.
snippet.description: Makes the actor follow the mouse.
snippet.name: Follow the Mouse

number.desc: The speed to move towards the mouse.
number.name: _Speed

number.desc: The actor will not move closer than this to the mouse.
number.name: _Margin

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will move faster if farther away from the mouse and slower if closer to to the mouse.
If unselected, the actor will move towards the target at a constant speed as specified in the Speed attribute.
boolean.name: _Easing

number.desc:
Only used when Easing is selected.
The actor will move at least at this speed. The actual speed depends on the distance to the mouse. The maximum speed is Minimum Easing Speed plus Speed. The actor will move at maximum speed if it is in the opposite diagonal corner of the mouse.
number.name: _MinimumEasingSpeed

text.desc:
Always: The actor will always follow the mouse.
When Pressed: The actor will follow the mouse only when it is pressed, and keep on moving when the mouse is released.
When Pressed, Else Stop: The actor will follow the mouse only when it is pressed, and stop when the mouse is released.
text.dropdown: Always=Always When Pressed=WhenPressed When Pressed, Else Stop=WhenPressedElseStop
text.name: _Follow

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The x-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The y-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraY

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current x-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current y-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraY

number.desc: The speed, in pixels per frame, that the camera should scroll by following the actor. Leave as 0 to indicate an instant jump.
number.name: _ScrollSpeed

boolean.desc: If selected, holding down the mouse will fire bullets.
boolean.name: _UsetheMouse

boolean.desc:
If selected, holding down the Fire Control will fire bullets.

You can also trigger the FireBullet event to fire a bullet.
boolean.name: _UseControls

number.desc: The maximum number of actors to be alive at the same time. Only used if <var>Limit Bullets Alive</var> is selected.
number.name: _MaximumBulletsAlive

boolean.desc: If selected, no more than <var>Maximum Bullets Alive</var> can be alive at the same time.
boolean.name: _LimitBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of bullets created per second.
number.name: _RateOfFire

text.desc: Shoot up if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _UpAnimations

text.desc: Shoot down if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _DownAnimations

text.desc: Shoot left if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _LeftAnimations

text.desc: Shoot right if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _RightAnimations

text.desc:
How to determine the direction of the bullets:

Relative - Treat Direction relative to the actor's orientation.
Absolute - Treat Direction as absolute.
Based on Animations - Determine the direction based on the current animation.
text.dropdown: Relative=Relative Absolute=Absolute Based on Animations=Based on Animations
text.name: _DirectionMode

number.desc:
The direction in which the bullet will move.
Only used if Direction Mode is Relative or Absolute. If Direction Mode is Based on Animations the following four attributes determine the direction instead.
number.dropdown: North=-90 North East=-45 East=0 South East=45 South=90 South West=135 West=180 North West=-135
number.name: _Direction

boolean.desc: If selected, the current ammunition will be reduced by one on every shot.
boolean.name: _UseAmmunition

number.desc: The offset in the direction of movement at which the bullets will be created.
number.name: _Offset

number.desc: The speed at which the bullets will move.
number.name: _BulletSpeed

number.desc:
The current ammunition the actor has when created.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
Trigger the Reload event to set the current ammunition to the maximum ammunition.
number.name: _CurrentAmmunition

snippet.desc: Makes the actor move back and forth horizontally.
snippet.description: Makes the actor move back and forth horizontally.
snippet.name: Back and Forth Horizontally

number.desc: The movement speed.
number.name: _Speed

number.desc: The distance the actor will be moving to the left.
number.name: _DistanceLeft

number.desc: The distance the actor will be moving to the right.
number.name: _DistanceRight

number.desc: The direction in which the actor will be moving when created.
number.name: _InitialDirection

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will change the movement direction when colliding.
If unselected, the actor will try to keep on moving in the current direction.
boolean.name: _ChangeDirectiononCollision

snippet.desc: Makes the actor move back and forth vertically.
snippet.description: Makes the actor move back and forth vertically.
snippet.name: Back and Forth Vertically

number.desc: The movement speed.
number.name: _Speed

number.desc: The distance the actor will be moving up.
number.name: _DistanceUp

number.desc: The distance the actor will be moving down.
number.name: _DistanceDown

number.desc: The direction in which the actor will be moving when created.
number.name: _InitialDirection

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will change the movement direction when colliding.
If unselected, the actor will try to keep on moving in the current direction.
boolean.name: _ChangeDirectiononCollision

snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make it die when it collides with an actor of a specific collision group.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make it die when it collides with an actor of a specific collision group.
snippet.name: Die On Collision With Group

actorgroup.desc: When the actor collides with an actor, it will die if the other actor is of from this group.
actorgroup.name: _Group

snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make it die when it collides with something.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make it die when it collides with something.
snippet.name: Die On Collision

snippet.desc: Spawn bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.description: Spawn bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.name: Fire Bullet

text.desc:
How to determine the direction of the bullets:

Relative - Treat Direction relative to the actor's orientation.
Absolute - Treat Direction as absolute.
Based on Animations - Determine the direction based on the current animation.
text.dropdown: Relative=Relative Absolute=Absolute Based on Animations=Based on Animations
text.name: _DirectionMode

number.desc: The speed at which the bullets will move.
number.name: _BulletSpeed

actortype.desc: The bullet actor type to create.
actortype.name: _BulletType

number.desc:
The direction in which the bullet will move.
Only used if Direction Mode is Relative or Absolute. If Direction Mode is Based on Animations the following four attributes determine the direction instead.
number.dropdown: North=-90 North East=-45 East=0 South East=45 South=90 South West=135 West=180 North West=-135
number.name: _Direction

number.desc: The offset in the direction of movement at which the bullets will be created.
number.name: _Offset

boolean.desc:
If selected, holding down the Fire Control will fire bullets.

You can also trigger the FireBullet event to fire a bullet.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, holding down the mouse will fire bullets.
boolean.name: _UsetheMouse

boolean.desc: If selected, no more than <var>Maximum Bullets Alive</var> can be alive at the same time.
boolean.name: _LimitBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of actors to be alive at the same time. Only used if <var>Limit Bullets Alive</var> is selected.
number.name: _MaximumBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of bullets created per second.
number.name: _RateOfFire

number.desc:
The maximum ammunition the actor can have.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
number.name: _MaximumAmmunition

number.desc:
The current ammunition the actor has when created.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
Trigger the Reload event to set the current ammunition to the maximum ammunition.
number.name: _CurrentAmmunition

boolean.desc: If selected, the current ammunition will be reduced by one on every shot.
boolean.name: _UseAmmunition

text.desc: Shoot up if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _UpAnimations

text.desc: Shoot down if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _DownAnimations

text.desc: Shoot left if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _LeftAnimations

text.desc: Shoot right if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _RightAnimations

snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make it die once it leaves the screen.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make it die once it leaves the screen.
snippet.name: Die On Leaving Screen

snippet.desc: Spawn bullets in all directions from the actor's position.
snippet.description: Spawn bullets in all directions from the actor's position.
snippet.name: Shoot Around the Clock

number.desc: The speed at which the bullets will move.
number.name: _BulletSpeed

actortype.desc: The bullet actor type to create.
actortype.name: _BulletType

number.desc: The offset in the direction of movement at which the bullets will be created.
number.name: _Offset

boolean.desc: If selected, the direction of movement for the bullets will be independent from the current direction of the actor.
boolean.name: _AbsoluteDirection

boolean.desc:
If selected, holding down the Fire Control will fire bullets.

You can also trigger the FireBullet event to fire a bullet.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, holding down the mouse will fire bullets.
boolean.name: _UsetheMouse

boolean.desc: If selected, no more than <var>Maximum Bullets Alive</var> can be alive at the same time.
boolean.name: _LimitBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of bullets to be alive at the same time. Only used if <var>Limit Bullets Alive</var> is selected.
number.name: _MaximumBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of bullets created per second.
number.name: _RateOfFire

number.desc:
The maximum ammunition the actor can have.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
number.name: _MaximumAmmunition

number.desc:
The current ammunition the actor has when created.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
Trigger the Reload event to set the current ammunition to the maximum ammunition.
number.name: _CurrentAmmunition

boolean.desc: If selected, the current ammunition will be reduced by one on every shot.
boolean.name: _UseAmmunition

number.desc: The number of bullets in a wave.
number.name: _NumberofBullets

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The x-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The y-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraY

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current x-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current y-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraY

number.desc: The speed, in pixels per frame, that the camera should scroll by following the actor. Leave as 0 to indicate an instant jump.
number.name: _ScrollSpeed

snippet.desc: Set the velocity and the turning speed for this actor at random.
snippet.description: Set the velocity and the turning speed for this actor at random.
snippet.name: Random Starting Velocity

number.desc:
The minimum speed.
The starting speed will be a random number between Minimum Speed and Maximum Speed.
number.name: _MinimumSpeed

number.desc: The maximum speed.
number.name: _MaximumSpeed

number.desc:
The minimum angle for the starting direction.
The direction of movement will be a random direction between Minimum Angle and Maximum Angle.
number.name: _MinimumAngle

number.desc: The maximum angle for the starting direction.
number.name: _MaximumAngle

number.desc:
The minimum turning speed.
The starting turning speed will be a random number between Minimum Speed and Maximum Speed.
number.name: _MinimumTurningSpeed

number.desc: The maximum turning speed.
number.name: _MaximumTurningSpeed

snippet.desc: Make the actor follow a given path.
snippet.description: Make the actor follow a given path.
snippet.name: Follow Path

list.desc:
The list of coordinates for the nodes of the path.

Each entry must be of type Text and must be one of the following formats:
  X,Y
or
  X,Y,Speed
X and Y are the scene coordinates of the node.
Speed is optional and is the speed to reach this node. If no Speed is specified the Default Speed will be used.
You can use the custom blocks that come with this behavior to add nodes or clear the path.
list.name: _Coordinates

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will continue to move to the first node after reaching the last node.
If unselected, the actor will stop after reaching the last node.
boolean.name: _Loop

number.desc: The default speed to reach any node.
number.name: _DefaultSpeed

boolean.desc:
If selected and the actor's position is different from the first node of the path, the actor will jump immediately to the first node.
If unselected, the actor will instead move at the given speed to the first node.
boolean.name: _JumptoStart

snippet.desc: The Health Manager will track the Actor's current health, as well as provide blocks for healing and damaging the Actor. It can also send messages to other behaviors to allow for a wide range of functionality.
snippet.description: The Health Manager will track the Actor's current health, as well as provide blocks for healing and damaging the Actor. It can also send messages to other behaviors to allow for a wide range of functionality.
snippet.name: Health Manager

number.desc: Amount of health to start with.
number.name: _StartingHealth

number.desc: Maximum amount of health.
number.name: _MaximumHealth

number.desc: HIDDEN - Tracks the current amount of health.
number.name: _CurrentHealth

text.desc: Send this message to all behaviors when the Actor is healed by any amount. Remove value to prevent a message from being sent.
text.name: _HealedMessage

text.desc: Send this message to all behaviors when the Actor is damaged by any amount. Remove the value to prevent a message from being sent.
text.name: _DamagedMessage

text.desc:
What should we do when the health reaches zero?
1. Kill Actor
2. Do Nothing
text.name: _ZeroHealthAction

number.desc: How long should the Actor become temporarily invincible after being damaged?
number.name: _DelayBetweenDamage

boolean.desc: Check this box if the Actor's health should persist (stay the same) from scene to scene.
boolean.name: _PersistentHealth

game-attribute.desc:
Note: This option is only used if the Persistent Health? box is checked.

Select a Game Attribute to track the health for this Actor. Make sure the Attribute starts with a value of 0 (zero). Do not use the same attribute for more than one Actor.
game-attribute.name: _HealthGameAttribute

text.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The name of the game attribute created within the behaviour.
text.name: _HealthIdentifier

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is damaged.
sound.name: _DamageSound

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is killed.
sound.name: _DeathSound

sound.desc: Play this sound when the Actor is healed.
sound.name: _HealSound

number.desc: Horizontal offset of the newly spawned actor from the original Actor.
number.name: xOffset

number.desc: Vertical offset of the newly spawned actor from the original Actor.
number.name: yOffset

number.desc: How long should the actor stay alive before disappearing? Leave at 0 to prevent the Actor from being removed.
number.name: lifespan

boolean.desc: Should the actor spawn another actor on death? Useful for death effects such as explosions.
boolean.name: _SpawnActorOnDeath

text.desc: Actor space (relative to upper left coordinate of Actor), or Screen Space (where 0,0 is upper left of screen)?
text.name: _DrawingLocation

number.desc: Horizontal offset in pixels
number.name: _HealthBarXOffset

number.desc: How many pixels should the outline be? Set to 0 to prevent an outline from drawing.
number.name: _HealthBarOutlineSize

number.desc: Vertical offset in pixels
number.name: _HealthBarYOffset

number.desc: In pixels
number.name: _HealthBarWidth

number.desc: In pixels
number.name: _HealthBarHeight

color.desc: Enter an outline colour that will display around the background of the health bar
color.name: _HealthBarOutlineColour

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 75%.
color.name: _ColourOver75

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 50%.
color.name: _ColourOver50

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is over 25%.
color.name: _ColourOver25

color.desc: Colour of the health bar when the health is under 25%.
color.name: _ColourUnder25

color.desc: Background colour of the health bar.
color.name: _HealthBarBackgroundColour

boolean.desc: Whether a health bar should be drawn or not.
boolean.name: _DrawHealthBar

snippet.desc: Reload the scene when this actor dies.
snippet.description: Reload the scene when this actor dies.
snippet.name: Reload Scene On Death

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the reload transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle
